column2: These laws effect treatment and tolerance between different cultures in the realm.
Cultural differences are not important between members of the court, and provinces will not adopt your culture
Provinces are encouraged to adopt your culture.
These laws effect treatment and tolerance between different religions in the realm.
Religious differences are not important between members of the court, and provinces will not be converted by a chaplain. Holy wars are prohibited.
Religious difference are less important, and conversions by a Chaplain are slower. Holy wars vassalize those of different religions rather than revoking.
Harsher attitudes towards those of different religions, and increased fervor in conversion.

These laws effect the balance of power in the Diwan.
The Bureaucratic wing of the council has a full say in decisions, holding the emperor and military under their control.
The Emperor shares power with the bureaucratic wing of the council.
The Military and Administrative factions of the Diwan are held in check, with the Emperor holding the most sway.
The Emperor shares power with the military wing of the council.
The Military wing of the council has a full say in decisions, holding the emperor and the bureaucracy under their control.
